node.title: Man found guilty of attempting to kill partner by setting her alight in backyard shed
node.description: A jury finds a man guilty of attempted murder for dousing his partner in petrol and setting her alight. His victim was left with burns to almost 70 per cent of her body.
node.content:
["A Tasmanian man has been found guilty of attempted murder after setting his girlfriend on fire during an argument four years ago.", "Over the past six and a half weeks in the Supreme Court in Hobart, the crown has worked to prove that the 39-year-old man\u00a0poured petrol on his then 20-year-old girlfriend and set her on fire with a lighter.", "She was left with burns to 68 per cent of her body.", "The jury took seven and a half hours to deliver a majority verdict, with 10 out of 12 jurors finding him guilty.", "The undisputed fact is that the pair,\u00a0who cannot be named for legal reasons, were arguing in a shed on a Chigwell property when she caught fire.", "The question the court tried to answer was: who was responsible?", "The state used recordings of phone calls and interactions to show he had a tendency towards violence and would threaten to burn or kill her if she left him.", "None of this was disputed by the defence, but it was noted that the abuse went both ways, and the threats were only a \"figure of speech\".", "
'He had to make good with the threat'
", "In the last days of the trial, deputy director of public prosecutions Linda Mason SC told the court the man initially threw petrol on the woman to scare her into submission.", "But she said that night it did not work. In fact, it made the woman angrier and so the man, who cannot be named for legal reasons,\u00a0had to take it a step further.", "\"The pressure cooker situation reached a boiling point and he had to make good with the threat,\" she told the jury.", "When the woman insisted on leaving and walked towards the exit he held out his arm and flicked a lighter.", "That was when she went up in flames.", "", "
During the trial, the woman claimed her partner doused her in petrol but the man claimed she spilt it on herself.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "The defence introduced evidence that the woman struggled with mental health issues and suicidal ideations and alleged she had made two suicide attempts on the day of the fire.", "When he took the stand, the man tried to convince the jury that it was the woman who spilled petrol on herself.", "He alleged the pair were arguing about another woman when she grabbed the petrol drum, shook it, spilled\u00a0petrol on herself and yelled: \"Do you want to see me\u00a0burn?\"", "He told the court she then tipped papers out of a backpack and rifled through them until she found a piece of paper with the woman's name on it.", "He claimed when she set that on fire, fuel on the floor caught alight and the pair tried to stamp it out.", "That was when she caught fire, he told the court.", "What was never disputed was that the man was the one to eventually put the flames out and call for help.", "He was remanded in custody and will be sentenced at a later date.\u00a0"]
